facts.fact: Linux Kernel was written by Linus Torvalds at the age of  21 years
Linux is not an OS, but it is the kernel, GNU Linux is the OS and it comes in several hundred flavours.
Initially in 1991, Linux kernel version 0.01 was released with 10239 lines of code.
A Standard Linux Kernel today has over 10 Million lines of code and it grows at the rate of 10% every year.
William Della Croce Jr. registered the name Linux and demanded royalty for it. Later, however he agreed to handover the trademark to Linus.
The Linux kernel’s official mascot is a penguin named Tux, abbreviation of tuxedo.
Debian v.4.0’s contains 283 million lines, cost to produce commercially : $7.37 billion
Linux Torvalds has been honoured by naming an asteroid after his name.
Avatar was completely developed on Linux platform using Foss in 3D Software.
Windows and the Linux kernel can run simultaneously on same machine using Cooperative Linux (coLinux).
An unmodified version of the Linux kernel is called – “Vanilla Kernel”.
WebOS, Android and Nokia’s Maemo phone OS are built on top of the Linux kernel.
WebOS, Android and Nokia’s Maemo phone OS are built on top of the Linux kernel.
